title: Public Procurement & Circular Economy
description: Understanding Swedish public procurement (LOU) and how circular construction principles apply - relevant for public projects and as benchmarks for private hotel developments.
descriptionNO: Forståelse av svensk offentlig anskaffelse (LOU) og hvordan sirkulære byggeprinsipper anvendes - relevant for offentlige prosjekter og som referanse for private hotellutvikling.

items.title: LOU 2016:1145
items.description: Swedish public procurement law - allows and encourages sustainability and innovation criteria in tenders. Contracting authorities can weight environmental and social factors.

items.title: Upphandlingsmyndigheten Guidance
items.description: Sweden's Public Procurement Authority has issued specific guidance on circular procurement, encouraging life-cycle cost and durability criteria in construction projects.

items.title: Riksrevisionen Assessment
items.description: Sweden's National Audit Office emphasizes using procurement as a tool for circular economy transition, with recommendations for improved sustainability requirements.

items.title: Specification Requirements
items.description: Public tenders can specify functional requirements that favor sustainable solutions: recycled content minimums, durability standards, repairability requirements.
examples: Example: Minimum 30% recycled content in furniture
Example: Modular design for easy component replacement

items.title: Evaluation Criteria Weighting
items.description: Sustainability can be weighted as a quality criterion alongside price. Common weightings: 60% price / 40% quality (including sustainability).
items.insight: Opens door for circular procurement without defaulting to 'new only' - educates contractors on evaluation criteria.

items.title: Environmental Requirements
items.description: Can include: climate footprint calculations, material origin documentation, end-of-life planning, chemical content restrictions (SVHC-free).

items.title: Social Requirements
items.description: Can include: Fair Trade certification, ILO convention compliance, local employment targets, accessibility standards.

items.title: LCC Methodology
items.description: LCC calculation is explicitly permitted under LOU. Includes: acquisition cost, operating/maintenance costs, energy costs, end-of-life/disposal costs.
items.advantage: Circular furniture often has lower LCC when durability and maintenance are factored in.

items.title: LCC Components for Furniture
items.description: 1) Purchase price 2) Installation 3) Maintenance over lifespan 4) Energy (if applicable) 5) Replacement frequency 6) End-of-life disposal or resale value.
items.insight: Reused furniture may show significantly lower LCC when resale value and extended lifespan are factored in (varies by project).

items.title: Documentation Requirements
items.description: For LCC bids: provide calculations with assumptions clearly stated, warranty terms, maintenance schedules, expected lifespan with evidence.

items.title: Innovationspartnerskap
items.description: Public-private partnership model where authority and supplier develop solutions together. Ideal for developing new circular furniture solutions with long-term offtake agreements.

items.title: Pre-Commercial Procurement
items.description: Procurement of R&D services before commercial deployment. Can fund development of circular product testing, material passport systems, or refurbishment processes.

items.title: Circular Economy Pilots
items.description: Several Swedish municipalities have identified circular construction as a priority area for innovation procurement, creating market opportunities.

items.title: LOU Does Not Apply to Private Projects
items.description: Private hotel developments are not bound by LOU. However, public sector standards increasingly influence private market expectations.

items.title: Indirect Market Influence
items.description: Public procurement criteria set benchmarks that spread to private sector through: investor ESG requirements, hotel chain policies, tenant expectations in mixed-use developments.
items.insight: Private developers often voluntarily align with public standards for market positioning.

items.title: PPP and Joint Ventures
items.description: Public-private partnerships or municipal joint ventures may require LOU-style compliance. Common in: conference hotels, tourism infrastructure, urban development zones.

items.title: Hotel Chain Alignment
items.description: Major chains like Scandic already prioritize recycled and reusable materials, aligning with public procurement direction without legal requirement.

items.title: TMF Report (October 2025)
items.description: Trä- och Möbelföretagen (TMF) recommends changes to LOU: weight quality and circularity higher, require longer lifespan and reuse provisions in public tenders.

items.title: Mandatory Reuse Plans
items.description: Finland already requires material inventory and reuse plans before demolition. Sweden may follow with similar requirements for renovation permits within 2-4 years.

items.title: Climate Declarations Extension
items.description: Current klimatdeklaration applies only to new construction. Expected expansion to major renovations, which would favor circular approaches.

items.title: Public Project Preparation
items.description: For publicly financed hotels or PPP projects: prepare formal documentation of recycled content, material certifications, and environmental performance.
checklist: Material passport for all reused items

items.title: Voluntary Alignment Benefits
items.description: Adopting public procurement standards voluntarily provides: quality assurance framework, market differentiation, future-proofing against regulatory changes.

items.title: Municipal Circular Programs
items.description: Leverage local circular economy initiatives: Gothenburg's upphandlingsmallar, Stockholm's pilot programs, regional sustainability networks.
items.recommendation: Gothenburg has most developed circular procurement tools - ideal for pilot projects.

items.title: Documentation as Competitive Advantage
items.description: Even for private projects, LOU-style documentation demonstrates quality and builds trust with clients, investors, and insurers.
